title: Beau Ryan admits he found it difficult being away from his family while filming The Amazing Race
text:
Former Rugby League star Beau Ryan is set to make his debut as the host of Channel 10's The Amazing Race Australia.

Now the TV presenter, 34, has spoken about what it was like to spend six weeks away from his wife of seven years, Kara, and their two young children - Remi, seven, and Jessie, two.

He admitted to The Daily Telegraph, on Saturday, that he is 'quite a needy guy' and that the longest he had ever been away from his family was two weeks.

'I'm quite a needy guy': Beau Ryan admitted he found it difficult to be away from his wife Kara, and their two young children - Remi, seven, and Jessie, two - while he filmed The Amazing Race

Beau revealed he even considered flying his family to meet him half way, but decided against it.

Instead, he committed to making daily FaceTime calls to show his family where in the world he was and where he planned on taking them.

'We went to some beautiful places, some barren places, some tropical places, we went to the mountains; but when I met the [African] people, I couldn't stop smiling,' he said.

Family man: Beau revealed he even considered flying his family to meet him half way, but decided against it and instead committed to daily FaceTime calls

This comes after his marriage hit a rocky patch back in 2015 after an alleged affair.

'We’ve been to hell and back, as you know, but I’ve grown a lot as a person, my wife has always been the strong one out of the two of us,' he told the publication.

On Thursday, Beau told 10daily there wasn't a lot of time between takes filming The Amazing Race Australia.

'We went to some beautiful places, some barren places, some tropical places, we went to the mountains; but when I met the [African] people, I couldn't stop smiling,' he said

'At the start of the race, we were waiting for a long time at the pit stops, but by the end of the race, because I was doing a lot of challenges, I was legit one minute ahead of the race,' he said.

Beau, who admitted he isn't a fan of sitting around waiting for slowpokes, confessed he enjoyed the increasing pace of the race - even if it wasn't good for the producers.

The Amazing Race Australia premieres Monday at 7.30pm on Channel 10
